title: 'I'd love to have an eco-friendly inhaler – but I'd be in hospital within a week'
text:
A common cold will leave most people feeling rotten for a day or two, but for Jess Speller it could mean being blue-lighted to hospital and spending three weeks in a special care unit.

The 24-year-old has severe asthma and was first diagnosed with the respiratory condition when she was just three-years old. Three years ago, the condition became severe; and in July last year, she was hospitalised after contracting a cold.

This week, new research by Cambridge University found that if asthma sufferers switched to 'green inhalers' the reduction in carbon emissions would be the same as cutting out meat.

But for Speller, making the switch would not only be detrimental to her health, it could be...
